column4: These [be] the words which Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] spoke unto all Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] on this side Yarden [Descender] in the wilderness, in the plain over against the Red [sea] , between Pa’ran [place of caverns] , and Tofel [White] , and Lavan [White] , and Hatzerot [A Place in the Wilderness] , and Di-Zahav [Enough Gold].
( [There are] eleven days’ [journey] from Horev [Desert] by the way of mount Se’ir [Shaggy] unto Kadesh [Holy] -Barnea [Holy] .)

And it came to pass in the fortieth year, in the eleventh month, on the first [day] of the month, [that] Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] spoke unto the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , according unto all that the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) had given him in commandment unto them;

After he had slain Sichon [Warrior] the king of the Emori [Highlanders] , which dwelt in Heshbon [Stronghold] , and ‘Og [Long-necked] the king of Bashan [Fruitful] , which dwelt at ‘Ashtarot [Star] in Edre’i [Good Pasture]:
On this side Yarden [Descender] , in the land of Mo’av [Seed of my Father] , began Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] to declare this law, saying,
The Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] spoke unto us in Horev [Desert] , saying, You 2f have dwelt long enough in this mount:

Turn you, and take your journey, and go to the mount of the Emori [Highlanders] , and unto all [the places] near thereunto, in the plain, in the hills, and in the vale, and in the south, and by the sea side, to the land of the Kena’ani [Merchant] , and unto L’vanon [Whiteness] , unto the great river, the river Euphrates (to break forth, to gush).

Behold, I have set the land before you: go in and possess the land which the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) swore unto your fathers, Avraham [Exalted Father] , Yitz’khak [Laughter] , and Ya’akov [Heal of God] , to give unto them and to their seed after them.
And I spoke unto you at that time, saying, I am not able to bear you myself alone:
The Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) your God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] has multiplied you, and, behold, you 2f [are] this day as the stars of heaven for multitude.

(The Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of your fathers make you a thousand times so many more as you 2f [are] , and bless you, as he has promised you!)
How can I myself alone bear your cumbrance, and your burden, and your strife?
Take you wise men, and understanding, and known among your tribes, and I will make them rulers over you.
And you 2f answered me, and said, The thing which you i have spoken [is] good [for us] to do.

So I took the chief of your tribes, wise men, and known, and made them heads over you, captains over thousands, and captains over hundreds, and captains over fifties, and captains over tens, and officers among your tribes.
And I charged your at that time, saying, Hear [the causes] between your brethren, and judge righteously between [every] man and his brother, and the stranger [that is] with him.

You 2f shall not respect persons in judgment; [but] you 2f shall hear the small as well as the great; you 2f shall not be afraid of the face of man; for the judgment [is] God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] ’s: and the cause that is too hard for you, bring [it] unto me, and I will hear it.
And I commanded you at that time all the things which you 2f should do.

And when we departed from Horev [Desert] , we went through all that great and terrible wilderness, which you 2f saw by the way of the mountain of the Emori [Highlanders] , as the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] commanded us; and we came to Kadesh [Holy] -Barnea [Holy].

And I said unto you, You 2f are come unto the mountain of the Emori [Highlanders] , which the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] does give unto us.

Behold, the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) you i God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] has set the land before you i : go up [and] possess [it] , as the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of you i fathers has said unto you i ; fear not, neither be discouraged.

And you 2f came near unto me every one of you, and said, We will send men before us, and they shall search us out the land, and bring us word again by what way we must go up, and into what cities we shall come.
And the saying pleased me well: and I took twelve men of you, one of a tribe:
And they turned and went up into the mountain, and came unto the valley of Eshkol [Cluster] , and searched it out.

And they took of the fruit of the land in their hands, and brought [it] down unto us, and brought us word again, and said, [It is] a good land which the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] does give us.
Yet you 2f would not go up, but rebelled against the commandment of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) your God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered]:

And you 2f murmured in your tents, and said, Because the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) hated us, he has brought us forth out of the land of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] , to deliver us into the hand of the Emori [Highlanders] , to destroy us.

Where shall we go up? our brethren have discouraged our heart, saying, The people [is] greater and taller than we; the cities [are] great and walled up to heaven; and moreover we have seen the sons of the ‘Anakim [Longed-Necked] there.
Then I said unto you, Dread not, neither be afraid of them.

The Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) your God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] which goes before you, he shall fight for you, according to all that he did for you in Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] before your eyes;

And in the wilderness, where you i have seen how that the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) you i God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] bore you i , as a man does bear his son, in all the way that you 2f went, until you 2f came into this place.
Yet in this thing you 2f did not believe the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) your God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered],
Who went in the way before you, to search you out a place to pitch your tents [in] , in fire by night, to show you by what way you 2f should go, and in a cloud by day.
And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) heard the voice of your words, and was exceedingly angry, and swore, saying,
Surely there shall not one of these men of this evil generation see that good land, which I swore to give unto your fathers,

Save Kalev [Dog] the son of Y’funeh [He Will Face] ; he shall see it, and to him will I give the land that he has trampled upon, and to his children, because he has wholly followed the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).
Also the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) was angry with me for your sakes, saying, you i also shall not go in there.

[But] Y’hoshua [Yehovah is Salvation] the son of Nun [Posterity] , which stands before you i , he shall go in there: encourage him: for he shall cause Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] to inherit it.

Moreover your little ones, which you 2f said should be a prey, and your children, which in that day had no knowledge between good and evil, they shall go in there, and unto them will I give it, and they shall possess it.
But [as for] you, turn you, and take your journey into the wilderness by the way of the Red sea.

Then you 2f answered and said unto me, We have sinned against the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , we will go up and fight, according to all that the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] commanded us. And when you 2f had girded on every man his weapons of war, you 2f were ready to go up into the hill.
And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said unto me, Say unto them, Go not up, neither fight; for I [am] not among you; lest you 2f be smitten before your enemies.
So I spoke unto you; and you 2f would not hear, but rebelled against the commandment of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and went presumptuously up into the hill.
And the Emori [Highlanders] , which dwelt in that mountain, came out against you, and chased you, as bees do, and destroyed you in Se’ir [Shaggy], [even] unto Hormah [Asylum].
And you 2f returned and wept before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) ; but the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) would not hearken to your voice, nor give ear unto you.
So you 2f abode in Kadesh [Holy] many days, according unto the days that you 2f abode [there].
Then we turned, and took our journey into the wilderness by the way of the Red sea, as the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) spoke unto me: and we compassed mount Se’ir [Shaggy] many days.
And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) spoke unto me, saying,
You 2f have compassed this mountain long enough: turn you northward.

And command you i the people, saying, You 2f [are] to pass through the coast of your brethren the children of ‘Esav [Hairy] , which dwell in Se’ir [Shaggy] ; and they shall be afraid of you: take you 2f good heed unto yourselves therefore:
Meddle not with them; for I will not give you of their land, no, not so much as a foot breadth; because I have given mount Se’ir [Shaggy] unto ‘Esav [Hairy] [for] a possession.
You 2f shall buy meat of them for money, that you 2f may eat; and you 2f shall also buy water of them for money, that you 2f may drink.

For the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) you i God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] has Blessed (Favored by God; happy; prosperous) you i in all the works of you i hand: he knows you i walking through this great wilderness: these forty years the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) you i God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] [has been] with you i ; you i have lacked nothing.

And when we passed by from our brethren the children of ‘Esav [Hairy] , which dwelt in Se’ir [Shaggy] , through the way of the plain from Eilat [Grove of Lofty Trees] , and from ‘Etzyon-Gever [Backbone of a Man] , we turned and passed by the way of the wilderness of Mo’av [Seed of my Father].

And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said unto me, Distress not the Mo’avi [of his father] , neither contend with them in battle: for I will not give you i of their land [for] a possession; because I have given ‘Ar [A City] unto the children of Lot [for] a possession.
The Emim [Terrors] dwelt in it in times past, a people great, and many, and tall, as the ‘Anakim [Longed-Necked];
Which also were accounted giants, as the ‘Anakim [Longed-Necked] ; but the Mo’avi [of his father] call them Emim [Terrors].

The Horim [Cave Dweller] also dwelt in Se’ir [Shaggy] formerly; but the children of ‘Esav [Hairy] succeeded them, when they had destroyed them from before them, and dwelt in their stead; as Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] did unto the land of his possession, which the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) gave unto them.
Now rise up, [said I] , and get you over the brook Zered [Osier Brook] . And we went over the brook Zered [Osier Brook].

And the space in which we came from Kadesh [Holy] -Barnea [Holy] , until we were come over the brook Zered [Osier Brook], [was] thirty and eight years; until all the generation of the men of war were wasted out from among the host, as the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) swore unto them.
For indeed the hand of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) was against them, to destroy them from among the host, until they were consumed.
So it came to pass, when all the men of war were consumed and dead from among the people,
That the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) spoke unto me, saying,
you i are to pass over through ‘Ar [A City] , the coast of Mo’av [Seed of my Father] , this day:

And [when] you i come near over against the children of ‘Amon [Inbred] , distress them not, nor meddle with them: for I will not give you i of the land of the children of ‘Amon [Inbred] [any] possession; because I have given it unto the children of Lot [for] a possession.
(That also was accounted a land of giants: giants dwelt in it in old time; and the ‘Amon [Inbred] call them Zamzumim [Plotters];
A people great, and many, and tall, as the ‘Anakim [Longed-Necked] ; but the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) destroyed them before them; and they succeeded them, and dwelt in their stead:

As he did to the children of ‘Esav [Hairy] , which dwelt in Se’ir [Shaggy] , when he destroyed the Horim [Cave Dweller] from before them; and they succeeded them, and dwelt in their stead even unto this day:

And the ‘Avim [Ruins] [Ruins] which dwelt in Hatzerim [Villages], [even] unto ‘Azah [The Strong] , the Kaftorim [A Crown] , which came forth out of Kaftor [A Crown] , destroyed them, and dwelt in their stead.)

Rise you 2f up, take your journey, and pass over the river ‘Arnon [Rushing Stream] : behold, I have given into you i hand Sichon [Warrior] the Emori [Rebellious Highlanders] , king of Heshbon [Stronghold] , and his land: begin to possess [it] , and contend with him in battle.

This day will I begin to put the dread of you i and the fear of you i upon the nations [that are] under the whole heaven, who shall hear report of you i , and shall tremble, and be in anguish because of you i.
And I sent messengers out of the wilderness of K’demot [Eastern] unto Sichon [Warrior] king of Heshbon [Stronghold] with words of peace, saying,
Let me pass through you i land: I will go along by the high way, I will neither turn unto the right hand nor to the left.
you i shall sell me meat for money, that I may eat; and give me water for money, that I may drink: only I will pass through on my feet;

(As the children of ‘Esav [Hairy] which dwell in Se’ir [Shaggy] , and the Mo’avi [of his father] which dwell in ‘Ar [A City] , did unto me;) until I shall pass over Yarden [Descender] into the land which the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] gives us.

But Sichon [Warrior] king of Heshbon [Stronghold] would not let us pass by him: for the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) you i God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] hardened his spirit, and made his heart obstinate, that he might deliver him into you i hand, as [appears] this day.
And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said unto me, Behold, I have begun to give Sichon [Warrior] and his land before you i : begin to possess, that you i may inherit his land.
Then Sichon [Warrior] came out against us, he and all his people, to fight at Yachatz [Trampled Down].
And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] delivered him before us; and we struck him, and his sons, and all his people.
And we took all his cities at that time, and utterly destroyed the men, and the women, and the little ones, of every city, we left none to remain:
Only the cattle we took for a prey unto ourselves, and the spoil (plunder; prey; booty) of the cities which we took.

From ‘Aeo’er [Ruins] , which [is] by the brink of the river of ‘Arnon [Rushing Stream] , and [from] the city that [is] by the river, even unto Gil’ad [Rocky Region] , there was not one city too strong for us: the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] delivered all unto us:

Only unto the land of the children of ‘Amon [Inbred] you i came not, [nor] unto any place of the river Yabok [luxuriant emptying river] , nor unto the cities in the mountains, nor unto whatsoever the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] forbad us.
Then we turned, and went up the way to Bashan [Fruitful] : and ‘Og [Long-necked] the king of Bashan [Fruitful] came out against us, he and all his people, to battle at Edre’i [Good Pasture].

And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said unto me, Fear him not: for I will deliver him, and all his people, and his land, into you i hand; and you i shall do unto him as you i did unto Sichon [Warrior] king of the Emori [Highlanders] , which dwelt at Heshbon [Stronghold].

So the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] delivered into our hands ‘Og [Long-necked] also, the king of Bashan [Fruitful] , and all his people: and we struck him until none was left to him remaining.

And we took all his cities at that time, there was not a city which we took not from them, threescore cities, all the region of Argov [Heap of Clods] , the kingdom of ‘Og [Long-necked] in Bashan [Fruitful].
All these cities [were] fenced with high walls, gates, and bars; beside unwalled towns a great many.
And we utterly destroyed them, as we did unto Sichon [Warrior] king of Heshbon [Stronghold] , utterly destroying the men, women, and children, of every city.
But all the cattle, and the spoil (plunder; prey; booty) of the cities, we took for a prey to ourselves.

And we took at that time out of the hand of the two kings of the Emori [Highlanders] the land that [was] on this side Yarden [Descender] , from the river of ‘Arnon [Rushing Stream] unto mount Hermon [A Sanctuary];
( [Which] Hermon [A Sanctuary] the Tzidonim [Hunting] call Siryon [Breastplate] ; and the Emori [Highlanders] call it S’nir [Snow Mountain] ;)

All the cities of the plain, and all Gil’ad [Rocky Region] , and all Bashan [Fruitful] , unto Salkhah [Migration] and Edre’i [Good Pasture] , cities of the kingdom of ‘Og [Long-necked] in Bashan [Fruitful].

For only ‘Og [Long-necked] king of Bashan [Fruitful] remained of the remnant of giants; behold, his bedstead [was] a bedstead of iron; [is] it not in Rabbah [Great] [Great] of the children of ‘Amon [Inbred] ? nine cubits [was] the length thereof, and four cubits the breadth of it, after the cubit of a man.

And this land, [which] we possessed at that time, from ‘Aeo’er [Ruins] , which [is] by the river ‘Arnon [Rushing Stream] , and half mount Gil’ad [Rocky Region] , and the cities thereof, gave I unto the Re’uveni [behold, a son!] and to the Gadi [my fortune] [A Troop].

And the rest of Gil’ad [Rocky Region] , and all Bashan [Fruitful], [being] the kingdom of ‘Og [Long-necked] , gave I unto the half tribe of M’nasheh [Causing to Forget] ; all the region of Argov [Heap of Clods] , with all Bashan [Fruitful] , which was called the land of giants.

Ya’ir [He Enlightens] the son of M’nasheh [Causing to Forget] took all the country of Argov [Heap of Clods] unto the coasts of G’shuri [Bridge] and Ma’akhati [Oppression] ; and called them after his own name, Bashan-Havot-Ya’ir [Fruitful Villages of the Enlightened Ones] , unto this day.
And I gave Gil’ad [Rocky Region] unto Makhir [Sold].

And unto the Re’uveni [behold, a son!] and unto the Gadi [my fortune] [A Troop] I gave from Gil’ad [Rocky Region] even unto the river ‘Arnon [Rushing Stream] half the valley, and the border even unto the river Yabok [luxuriant emptying river], [which is] the border of the children of ‘Amon [Inbred];

The plain [‘Aravah] also, and Yarden [Descender] , and the coast [thereof] , from Kinneret [Harps] even unto the sea of the plain, [even] the salt sea, under Ashdot-Pisgah [fountain near the mountain cleft (split hoof; an opening, break or split)] eastward.

And I commanded you at that time, saying, The Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) your God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] has given you this land to possess it: you 2f shall pass over armed before your brethren the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , all [that are] meet for the war.
But your wives, and your little ones, and your cattle, ( [for] I know that you 2f have much cattle,) shall abide in your cities which I have given you;

Until the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) have given rest unto your brethren, as well as unto you, and [until] they also possess the land which the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) your God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] has given them beyond Yarden [Descender] : and [then] shall you 2f return every man unto his possession, which I have given you.

And I commanded Y’hoshua [Yehovah is Salvation] at that time, saying, You 1s eyes have seen all that the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) your God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] has done unto these two kings: so shall the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) do unto all the kingdoms to which you i pass.
You 2f shall not fear them: for the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) your God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] he shall fight for you.
And I besought the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) at that time, saying,

O Lord-Adonai [Greatest Above All Things] GOD-Yehōvih (THE FATHER) , you i have begun to show your i servant your i greatness, and your i mighty hand: for what God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] [is there] in heaven or in earth, that can do according to you i works, and according to your i might?
I pray you i , let me go over, and see the good land that [is] beyond Yarden [Descender] , that goodly mountain, and L’vanon [Whiteness].

But the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) was exceedingly angry with me for your sakes, and would not hear me: and the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said unto me, Let it suffice you i ; speak no more unto me of this matter.

Get you i up into the top of Pisgah [Cleft (split hoof; an opening, break or split) Mountain Range] , and lift up you i eyes westward, and northward, and southward, and eastward, and behold [it] with you i eyes: for you i shall not go over this Yarden [Descender].
But charge Y’hoshua [Yehovah is Salvation] , and encourage him, and strengthen him: for he shall go over before this people, and he shall cause them to inherit the land which you i shall see.
So we abode in the valley over against Beit-P’or [House of the Cleft (split hoof; an opening, break or split)].

Now therefore hearken, O Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , unto the statutes and unto the judgments, which I teach you, for to do [them] , that you 2f may live, and go in and possess the land which the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of your fathers gives you.

You 2f shall not add unto the word which I command you, neither shall you 2f diminish [ought] from it, that you 2f may keep the commandments of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) your God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] which I command you.

Your eyes have seen what the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) did because of Ba’al-P’or [Lord of the Opening] : for all the men that followed Ba’al-P’or [Lord of the Opening] , the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) you i God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] has destroyed them from among you.
But you 2f that did cling to (hold onto; stick to) the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) your God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] [are] alive every one of you this day.

Behold, I have taught you statutes and judgments, even as the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) my God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] commanded me, that you 2f should do so in the land to which you 2f go to possess it.

Keep therefore and do [them] ; for this [is] your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the nations, which shall hear all these statutes, and say, Surely this great nation [is] a wise and understanding people.

For what nation [is there so] great, who [has] God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] [so] near unto them, as the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] [is] in all [things that] we call upon him [for]?
And what nation [is there so] great, that has statutes and judgments [so] righteous as all this law, which I set before you this day?

Only take heed to yourself, and keep you i soul diligently, lest you i forget the things which you i eyes have seen, and lest they depart from you i heart all the days of you i life: but teach them you i sons, and you i sons’ sons;

[Specially] the day that you i stood before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) you i God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] in Horev [Desert] , when the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said unto me, Gather me the people together, and I will make them hear my words, that they may learn to fear me all the days that they shall live upon the earth, and [that] they may teach their children.
And you 2f came near and stood under the mountain; and the mountain burned with fire unto the midst of heaven, with darkness, clouds, and thick darkness.
And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) spoke unto you out of the midst of the fire: you 2f heard the voice of the words, but saw no similitude; only [you 2f heard] a voice.
And he declared unto you his covenant, which he commanded you to perform, [even] ten commandments; and he wrote them upon two tables of stone.
And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and judgments, that you 2f might do them in the land to which you 2f go over to possess it.

Take you 2f therefore good heed unto yourselves; for you 2f saw no manner of similitude on the day [that] the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) spoke unto you in Horev [Desert] out of the midst of the fire:
Lest you 2f corrupt [yourselves] , and make you a graven image, the similitude of any figure, the likeness of male or female,
The likeness of any beast that [is] on the earth, the likeness of any winged fowl that flies in the air,
The likeness of anything that creeps on the ground, the likeness of any fish that [is] in the waters beneath the earth:
